text: Alfredo "Chocolate" Armenteros (4 April 1928 - 6 January 2016) was a Cuban trumpeter. He has played with artists such as Arsenio Rodríguez, Generoso Jiménez, Chico O'Farrill, Orchestra Harlow, Eddie Palmieri and Cachao. He was known for making Afro-Cuban jazz, Latin jazz and salsa more popular in the United States where he lived. He was sometimes called "Cuban Louis Armstrong". Armenteros was born in Santa Clara, Las Villas. He was married eight times, and had nine children, one son and eight daughters. Armenteros died from prostate cancer on 6 January 2016 in New York City. He was 87. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Cuban musicians Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Jazz musicians Category:Trumpeters
title: Alfredo "Chocolate" Armenteros
